ref: 5235 *jīrati ʻ grows old ʼ. [~ *jhirati2: replaces jīˊryati AV. -- &rcirclemacr Pa. jīrati ʻ grows old, is digested ʼ; Pk. jīraï ʻ becomes old or worn out ʼ, jīravaï ʻ digests ʼ; P. jīrnā ʻ to be absorbed (of water) ʼ; G. *jīrvũ whence caus. jeravvũ ʻ to digest ʼ; M. jirṇẽ ʻ to be absorbed, be digested ʼ; Si. diranavā ʻ to decay, rot ʼ, caus. diravanavā; -- K. (Elmslie) "zirin" ʻ old man ʼ, Si. diriṇi ʻ old woman ʼ prob. with LM 335 < *jīraṇa -- . -- L. jīvaraṇ, jīuraṇ ʻ (water) to be absorbed ʼ, P. jīvarnā, jīurnā are obscure.
